children.text:
Another warm and breezy afternoon under partly cloudy skies. We topped out in the upper 70s and low 80s with breezy NE winds keeping the coastal areas in the mid 70s.  This evening will be another beautiful one- sinknig from the mild 70s into the cool 50s late tonight.

Expect mainly clear tonight with light patchy fog expected Friday morning.  We will wake up to temperatures in the 50s inland, with upper 50s to low 60s inland.  Afternoon highs will once again see upper 70s to low 80s inland, mid to upper 70s along the beaches.  Winds will be out of the Northeast between 10-15 mph.

Here come the 80s!  Saturday and Sunday will see slightly warmer afternoon highs with widespread 80s inland, mid to upper 70s along the beaches.  The onshore flow continues with a tilt from the south.  Winds will be out of the Southeast between 5-15 mph. There is an isolated chance for a coastal shower. 

Easter sunrise services will see upper 50s to low 60s inland with low to mid 60s along the beaches.  Sunrise 6:58 am  Wind: Calm becoming SE 5-10 mph.

Enjoy!
-Rebecca
